questiontext.text:
üìä Labor Market Statistics - Unemployment Rate

Calculate the unemployment rate for Econland during an economic recession.

Given Labor Market Data:

  • Labor Force: 12,500 thousand
  • Employed: 10,875 thousand
  • Unemployed: 1,625 thousand

Formula: Unemployment Rate = (Unemployed √∑ Labor Force) √ó 100%

Instructions: Give your answer as a percentage to 1 decimal place.

generalfeedback.text:
üí° Solution Steps:

  1. Apply unemployment rate formula: Rate = (Unemployed √∑ Labor Force) √ó 100%
  2. Substitute values: Rate = (1,625 √∑ 12,500) √ó 100%
  3. Calculate ratio: Rate = 0.13 √ó 100%
  4. Final answer: Unemployment Rate = 13.0%
üìâ Economic Analysis: An unemployment rate of 13.0% indicates severe economic recession with significant job losses. This high rate suggests widespread economic distress and need for policy intervention.

questiontext.text:
üìà Labor Market Statistics - Employment Rate

Calculate the employment rate for Statistopia during normal economic conditions.

Given Labor Market Data:

  • Labor Force: 8,250 thousand
  • Employed: 7,755 thousand
  • Unemployed: 495 thousand

Formula: Employment Rate = (Employed √∑ Labor Force) √ó 100%

Instructions: Give your answer as a percentage to 1 decimal place.

generalfeedback.text:
üí° Solution Steps:

  1. Apply employment rate formula: Rate = (Employed √∑ Labor Force) √ó 100%
  2. Substitute values: Rate = (7,755 √∑ 8,250) √ó 100%
  3. Calculate ratio: Rate = 0.94 √ó 100%
  4. Final answer: Employment Rate = 94.0%
üìä Economic Analysis: An employment rate of 94.0% indicates healthy labor market conditions with most people in the labor force successfully employed. This corresponds to a 6.0% unemployment rate, which is near normal levels.

questiontext.text:
üë• Labor Market Statistics - Participation Rate

Calculate the labor force participation rate for Dataville during an economic boom.

Given Population Data:

  • Working Age Population: 15,200 thousand
  • Labor Force: 10,564 thousand
  • Not in Labor Force: 4,636 thousand

Formula: Participation Rate = (Labor Force √∑ Working Age Population) √ó 100%

Instructions: Give your answer as a percentage to 1 decimal place.

generalfeedback.text:
üí° Solution Steps:

  1. Verify data consistency: Working Age Pop = Labor Force + Not in Labor Force = 10,564 + 4,636 = 15,200 ‚úì
  2. Apply participation rate formula: Rate = (Labor Force √∑ Working Age Population) √ó 100%
  3. Substitute values: Rate = (10,564 √∑ 15,200) √ó 100%
  4. Calculate ratio: Rate = 0.695 √ó 100% = 69.5%
üìà Economic Analysis: A participation rate of 69.5% during an economic boom indicates strong labor market engagement, with high employment opportunities encouraging people to actively participate in the workforce.

n.text: Labor Market - Not in Labor Force Calculation

questiontext.text:
üìä Labor Market Statistics - Not in Labor Force

Calculate how many people are not in the labor force in Numberburg during normal economic conditions.

Given Population Data:

  • Working Age Population: 22,800 thousand
  • Labor Force: 14,592 thousand
  • Labor Force Participation Rate: 64.0%

Formula: Not in Labor Force = Working Age Population - Labor Force

Instructions: Give your answer in thousands of people.

generalfeedback.text:
üí° Solution Steps:

  1. Verify participation rate: (14,592 √∑ 22,800) √ó 100% = 64.0% ‚úì
  2. Apply formula: Not in Labor Force = Working Age Population - Labor Force
  3. Substitute values: Not in Labor Force = 22,800 - 14,592
  4. Calculate result: Not in Labor Force = 8,208 thousand
üë®‚Äçüéì Economic Analysis: 8,208 thousand people not in the labor force includes students, retirees, homemakers, disabled individuals, and discouraged workers who have stopped looking for employment.

n.text: Labor Market - Labor Force Size Calculation

questiontext.text:
üë• Labor Market Statistics - Labor Force Size

Calculate the total labor force for Graphton during an economic recession.

Given Employment Data:

  • Employed: 9,180 thousand
  • Unemployed: 1,530 thousand
  • Unemployment Rate: 14.3%

Formula: Labor Force = Employed + Unemployed

Instructions: Give your answer in thousands of people.

generalfeedback.text:
üí° Solution Steps:

  1. Apply labor force formula: Labor Force = Employed + Unemployed
  2. Substitute values: Labor Force = 9,180 + 1,530
  3. Calculate total: Labor Force = 10,710 thousand
  4. Verify unemployment rate: (1,530 √∑ 10,710) √ó 100% = 14.3% ‚úì
üìâ Economic Analysis: During this recession, the labor force of 10.71 million includes both employed workers (9.18 million) and those actively seeking employment (1.53 million), representing the total active workforce.

questiontext.text:
üéØ Labor Market Statistics - Complete Analysis

Complete comprehensive labor market analysis for Analysis Town during normal economic conditions.

Given Economic Data:

  • Total Population: 45,000 thousand
  • Working Age Population: 32,400 thousand
  • Employed: 19,440 thousand
  • Unemployed: 1,080 thousand

Calculate the following labor market indicators:

Part A: Labor Force = {1:NUMERICAL:=20520:10} thousand

Part B: Unemployment Rate = {1:NUMERICAL:=5.3:0.1}%

Part C: Employment Rate = {1:NUMERICAL:=94.7:0.1}%

Part D: Labor Force Participation Rate = {1:NUMERICAL:=63.3:0.1}%

Part E: Not in Labor Force = {1:NUMERICAL:=11880:10} thousand

Part F: Working Age as % of Total Population = {1:NUMERICAL:=72.0:0.1}%

generalfeedback.text:
üí° Complete Solution:

Part A: Labor Force Calculation

Formula: Labor Force = Employed + Unemployed

Calculation: Labor Force = 19,440 + 1,080 = 20,520 thousand

Part B: Unemployment Rate

Formula: Rate = (Unemployed √∑ Labor Force) √ó 100%

Calculation: Rate = (1,080 √∑ 20,520) √ó 100% = 5.3%

Part C: Employment Rate

Formula: Rate = (Employed √∑ Labor Force) √ó 100%

Calculation: Rate = (19,440 √∑ 20,520) √ó 100% = 94.7%

Part D: Labor Force Participation Rate

Formula: Rate = (Labor Force √∑ Working Age Pop.) √ó 100%

Calculation: Rate = (20,520 √∑ 32,400) √ó 100% = 63.3%

Part E: Not in Labor Force

Formula: Not in LF = Working Age Pop. - Labor Force

Calculation: Not in LF = 32,400 - 20,520 = 11,880 thousand

Part F: Working Age Share

Formula: Share = (Working Age Pop. √∑ Total Pop.) √ó 100%

Calculation: Share = (32,400 √∑ 45,000) √ó 100% = 72.0%

üìä Economic Summary: Analysis Town shows healthy labor market conditions during normal economic times with moderate unemployment (5.3%), strong employment rate (94.7%), and good participation (63.3%). The working-age population represents 72% of total population, indicating a demographic structure capable of supporting economic growth.
